clinical_study.brief_title: Individualized Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation for Gait Function in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Individualized Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation for Gait Function in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the effects of individualized brain stimulation based on simulation and conventional brain stimulation in healthy adults.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The study was terminated due to difficulty in recruiting subjects

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline (before stimulation) after stimulation during 30 min
primary_outcome.description: changes in cortical activation is measured by functional Near-Infrared-Spectroscopy (fNIRS) (NIRScout, NIRx, Germany) during treadmill gait.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before stimulation (baseline); After strimulation during 30 min
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of self selected speeds by measuring the time it takes an individual to walk 10 meters. To perform the test, patient walks 10 meters (33 ft) and the time is measured when the leading foot crosses the start line and the finish line. The instructions are: "Please walk this distance at your normal pace when I say go."

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before stimulation (baseline); After strimulation during 30 min
secondary_outcome.description: The Timed Up and Go test (TUG) is a simple test used to assess a person's mobility and requires both static and dynamic balance. It uses the time that a person takes to rise from a chair, walk three meters, turn around, walk back to the chair, and sit down.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before stimulation (baseline); After strimulation during 30 min
secondary_outcome.description: Gait analysis is a process of measuring and evaluating the walking patterns of patients by using surface electromyograph.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gait analysis using motion analysis system
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before stimulation (baseline); After strimulation during 30 min
secondary_outcome.description: Gait analysis is a process of measuring and evaluating the walking patterns of patients by using motion analysis system.

arm_group.description: Based on transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) simulation, individualized stimulation on leg motor areas during 30 minutes.
Conventional stimulation on leg motor areas during 30 minutes.

intervention.description: Based on tDCS stimulation, individualized stimulation during 30 minutes with sitting position.
Conventional tDCS stimulation during 30 minutes with sitting position.
